results.title: Tasmanian wild life
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: Tasmania’s characteristic rough mountainous terrain serves as a sanctuary for preserving its natural wildlife. Features the Tasmanian devil and Tasmanian tiger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.description: Tasmania’s characteristic rough mountainous terrain serves as a sanctuary for preserving its natural wildlife. Features the Tasmanian devil and Tasmanian tiger.

results.title: Tasmanian tapestry
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows some of the highlights of Tasmania’s scenery. Pictures the many threads which combine to form the tapestry of life in the State of Tasmania - a pattern composed of high, snowcapped mountains, lakes, fast streams, hop fields, orchards, towns and cities rich in colonial history: of fast developing secondary industries, great mineral resources and expanding hydro-electric schemes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh McInnes, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Tasmanian adventure
results.brief_description: A tour of the scenic highlights of Tasmania, showing the variety of scenery, and the many sports available to the visitor. Shows beaches, rivers, rainforests, and rugged mountains where people can swim, sail, fish, surf and ski.
results.description: A tour of the scenic highlights of Tasmania, showing the variety of scenery, and the many sports available to the visitor. Shows beaches, rivers, rainforests, and rugged mountains where people can swim, sail, fish, surf and ski.

results.title: Tasmania: Australia's apple isle
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Apples grown in Tasmanian orchards appear in homes in distant parts of the world. This film gives an impression of the skill and care that goes into the growing of these apples, and in addition, shows much of the beauty of this southern isle. Narrated by Rex Waldron. Photography by Don Anderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit

results.title: Tasmania, a place for all seasons: winter
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Ray Barnes and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film shows snow sport, an antique auction, dining in luxury, the casino and many other activities which prove that Tasmania is a place to visit even in the winter time.
